intro: Hibbertia cistiflora subsp. quadristaminea, commonly known as the four-stamen hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers with four stamens. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions of southern Australia. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. Hibbertia cistiflora subsp. quadristaminea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant.
